alert.note: Alert for Clinton (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 04 at 10:26AM CDT until April 04 at 11:30AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Rock Island County in northwestern Illinois... Northeastern Putnam County in north central Illinois... Whiteside County in northwestern Illinois... Northeastern Henry County in northwestern Illinois... Southeastern Carroll County in northwestern Illinois... Bureau County in north central Illinois... East central Clinton County in east central Iowa... * Until 1130 AM CDT. * At 1024 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Spring Hill, or 17 miles south of Morrison, moving east at 40 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM! HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and two inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Hooppole and Leon Corners around 1030 AM CDT. Yorktown around 1035 AM CDT. Tampico and Thomas around 1040 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include New Bedford, Deer Grove, Manlius, Normandy, Walnut, Kasbeer and Ohio. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building.
